intro: Paraspalathus scholliana, commonly known as the Scholliana fern, is a member of the Dryopteridaceae family, characterized by its delicate fronds and intricate foliage. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices, where it thrives in cool and humid conditions. The plant features a rhizomatous growth habit, with fertile fronds producing spores on the undersides of the leaves. Its leaves are usually bipinnate, with a feathery appearance, and can vary in color from green to reddish-brown depending on the season. Paraspalathus scholliana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
